grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 奔放【ホンポウ】wild, uninhibited, extravagant, rampant
奔走【ホンソウ】running about, making every effort, being busily engaged (in something), good offices
狂奔【キョウホン】rushing around, running wild
kun reading compounds: 走る【はしる】to run, to travel (movement of vehicles), to drive, to flow (e.g. energy), to hurry to, to retreat (from battle), to take flight, to run away from home, to elope, to tend heavily toward, to flash, to streak, to shoot through (e.g. pain), to get involved, to take (to something), to get wrapped up in
